events.name: Informal Meet and Greet in Burbank
events.description:
Hey all, we're having our first meeting of 2012, a meet-and-greet at 7 PM on Thursday, May 24 at Gordon Biersch in beautiful downtown Burbank.

This is going to be a very informal meeting. That means we'll mostly just be hanging out and talking on the Gordon Biersch patio, weather permitting, so there won't be any speakers or demos scheduled (and you're totally going to be paying for your own check!) But that also means you can show up a little late or leave early, no problem.

We're just going to have a little social time, make friends and enjoy the evening, much like our 2011 meeting. But this time we're going to devise our schemes, er, make our plans for upcoming meetings. So if you have an idea about something you might want to speak about in the future, that would be so very welcome.

We'll put the details on our newly-minted Meetup group soon as well if you want to join there, but no RSVP is needed — you can just drop by. Hope you can join us for the inaugural GDG LA meeting!

events.name: Join Us for Our First Meetup of 2013!
events.description:
Please join us in North Hollywood for our first meetup of the year!

We'll discuss Apps Script, oAuth, Prediction API and more.

events.name: Intro to Google Analytics Content Experiments and Google Code Jam
events.description:
Huge thanks to Taurad and Scott Wiseman for setting up our first 405-adjacent meeting! We have room for 8 members, so, and I hate to say this, but since we have a limited capacity and this is our first meeting in the 310, please RSVP only if you are in the area and very likely to come. But if so, RSVP now.

I will be presenting on two topics: one is slightly technical and one extremely nerdy — something for everyone! Here's the schedule:

 

• 7:00 - 7:15 Conversation time

• 7:15 - 7:30 Announcements and group introductions

• 7:30 - 8:10 Introduction to Google Analytics Content Experiments

• 8:20 - 9:00 Introduction to Google Code Jam (I'll demonstrate using my Ruby library for Google Code Jam, but it will also be a general overview)

 

Again, since we will fill up, if you RSVP and turn out to be unable to make it, change your RSVP to No to allow another to attend.  I will present the Google Analytics Content Experiments at our next meeting, which is scheduled to be back at MK Partners in NoHo, later in March (details to follow). And rest assured, we will be back in the 310 soon!

HUGE thanks to Scott Wiseman at Taurad for stepping up and making this happen by offering us this venue. Taurad helps companies take their online presence to a new level, and you can visit http://www.taurad.com/ to check them out. Hope to see you there.
events.how_to_find_us: Next to Howard Hughes Center, Suite #135

events.name: April Meeting in NoHo
events.description:
Hi everyone! After a trip to the Culver City area, we are coming back to North Hollywood for our next regular meeting.

This meeting will include a re-run of the Google Code Jam talk from last meeting since it will be right before the first round starts.

Further presentations are yet to be determined, so please get in touch if you have a particular Google technology or related experience you would like to talk about. We have openings for 5-minute super-quick presentations, more standard 20-30 minute presentations, or even a 15-minute round-table style topic discussion. Please email the organizer for more details.

We look forward to seeing you in North Hollywood on the 8th!
events.how_to_find_us: On the second level - look for the stairway up!

events.name: Android Wear Codelab
events.description:
Due to popularity of this event, attendance will be limited to those that pre-register at: http://goo.gl/Qb3mWl

Join GDG LA as we work together on the Android Wear Codelab.  Android Wear is the hottest topic of the year, with every major vendor releasing their own device.  Learn how to write your own Android applications that can be run on wearable devices (or phones/tablets).  Come prepared with your Android 4.3+ device, laptop with prerequisites installed, phone USB cable, and ability to code awesomeness.

Pre-requisites are detailed here:
http://www.slideshare.net/optimizedprime/android-wear-code-lab-preparation

Pizza and soda will be served.  Shwag will be given away.

<b style="font-size : 16px">WE WILL NOT BE GIVING AWAY ANY WEARABLE DEVICES

Also hear from our special guest, Google Developer Expert Masashi Katsumata, who will provide a demo on his updated PhoneGap-Google Maps plugin.﻿

We'll see everyone there!

events.name: Polymer DevFest
events.description:
AFTER YOU RSVP ON MEETUP, A REGISTRATION FORM WILL BE SENT TO YOU.  YOU MUST FILL OUT THAT FORM IN ORDER TO GAIN ENTRANCE!

THIS IS A DEVELOPER ONLY EVENT!

Its Hackademic With Polymer

Come join us for an evening DevFest focused on Polymer.  This is a chance to dive head first into Polymer and walk away with not just an understanding of the platform, but concrete tools and experience in building out your own web-component enabled applications. Don't miss it!!

• 5:30pm: 1 hour Check In/Mingle/Food

• 6:30pm: 45 min Introductory presentation

• 7:15pm: 15 min Break

• 7:30pm: 15min Polymer Basics (interactive samples)

• 7:45pm: 45min Tutorial Codelab

• 8:30pm: 5-10 min Break

• 8:40pm: 35 min Maps Codelab

• 9:15pm: 5 min back to Point Break

• 9:20pm: 10-15 min Closing

• 9:35pm: Event End

events.name: Chromecast Tech Talk
events.description:
RSVP IN ADVANCE TO ENSURE YOUR SPOT!!!

What: Chromecast: Bringing your Android Content to the Big Screen with Google CastHave you ever wanted to expand your Android app to enable a multi-screen experience, leveraging large display devices like a television? Google Cast allows you to share content with a Google Cast receiver device, such as a Chromecast. Google Cast Android senders use the familiar controls of your android phone or tablet to control the experience of your application on the big screen. In this class, we will talk about Android sender app development. We will also cover some of the best practices to keep your Cast experience simple, intuitive, and predictable.

Who: Kevin Nilson works at Google as the team lead of the Chromecast Technical Solutions Engineer team. Kevin is a Java Champion and three-time JavaOne Rock Star. Kevin has spoken at conferences such as JavaOne, Devoxx, O'Reilly Fluent, NFJS SpringOne, JAX, Silicon Valley Code Camp, HTML5DevConf, On Android and AjaxWorld. He is also the co-author of "Web 2.0 Fundamentals." In the past, Kevin was an adjunct professor at the College of San Mateo. Kevin holds a MS and BS in Computer Science from Southern Illinois University. He is the leader of the Silicon Valley Java User Group, Silicon Valley Google Developer Group, Silicon Valley JavaScript Meetup and Devoxx4Kids Bay Area.

When: Dec 10, 6-8pm.

Where: Dodger Stadium room, Google Los Angeles, 340 Main St, Venice

Parking: Attendees may use Google's underground parking structure. Drive between the two binoculars in the front of the Google office located at 340 Main St. in Venice, CA. Then use the buzzer on the left hand side of the driveway before the gate to let reception know you are here for "GDG Los Angeles Chromecast talk". Once access is granted, you may drive below to the underground parking structure and self park. Please take the elevator to floor 1, where a Googler will be waiting to assist with name badges and escorting to the Dodger Stadium room. See attached photo and map.

events.name: Talk about Android (Venice)
events.description:
Join us for a talk on Android from Eric Pomerleau title: Crossing the Streams - Online Video Streaming on Android

Eric is the leading Android Software Engineer at Victorious, a startup aiming to better connect online content creators with their communities.  Prior to working at Victorious, Eric was also a software engineer at Google.

This event will be streamed live between North Hollywood and Venice.  You may attend either location.

events.name: Talk about Android (NoHo)
events.description:
Join us for a talk on Android from Eric Pomerleau title: Crossing the Streams - Online Video Streaming on Android

Eric is the leading Android Software Engineer at Victorious, a startup aiming to better connect online content creators with their communities.  Prior to working at Victorious, Eric was also a software engineer at Google.

This event will be streamed live between North Hollywood and Venice.  You may attend either location.

events.name: Android TV Hackathon

venue.name: USC Annenberg School for Communication & Journalism

events.description:
REGISTRATION IS REQUIRED AT EVENTBRITE

http://www.eventbrite.com/e/android-tv-hackathon-tickets-15313695676

GDG Los Angeles presents the 2015 Android TV Hackathon sponsored by Google and Victorious.  This event is an intense one-day hackathon for app designers and developers to come together to compete in a team competition.  The event is taking place at USC's Annenberg Innovation Lab: http://www.annenberglab.com/

A team of Android developers will be available to provide you with instructions and tips.

Judging will be done by a panel including experts from Google and Victorious.  Teams will be judged on the quality of their app built in the limited time allocated as well as its future potential.  Multiple prizes will be available for different categories of apps.

Food, drinks and internet will be provided!  

Participants will also receive shwag and a special gift to help you further develop for Android TV while supplies last.

You must bring your own laptop with IDE and SDKs pre-installed.

Space is limited, so please purchase your ticket today!

Tentative Agenda

9:30am - Doors Open10:00am - Introductory remarks10:20am - Team forming10:45am - Hack and attend workshops5:00pm - Presentation dry runs6:00pm - Presentations and Awards

events.name: GDG LA March Meetup
events.description:
Join GDG LA for our March Meetup at Google's Los Angeles office.

We have a full agenda for this meetup, so please arrive on time.  Refreshments will be served and door prizes will be given!

AGENDA

• This month in Google

You GDG Los Angeles Organizers educate you on everything you need to know about the world in Google. 

• Integrating Cloud SQL with Google Apps Script

Frank Solomon - BitVectors

Frank is a longtime writer of research and discoveries that focus on how to build software that adds value.  He has experience working with many Google technologies as well as iOS.

• Android TV Hackathon

Philip Hunt - CrowdTorch

Philip is a full stack web application developer that gets excited about interface design and interactivity.  When he is not trying to catch up on all the shows he's missed, he's tinkering with JavaScript code to make it more efficient or concise.  Lately he has been working with the Android API to join the mobile world.

Ried Isaki - Discovery Digital Networks

Reid is a software engineer for Discovery Channel.  His primary focus is Android but he also works with iOS, Amazon Fire SDK's, and OTT.  He is really into cats, motorcycles and real estate.

• Testing Android Applications

Brando Madden & Thibault Alix - Fullscreen Inc.

Brando is the QA lead and Android dev at Fullscreen Inc. Brando has previously worked at DirecTV and the largest medical device manufacturer in the USA. He has a passion for mobile and wearable devices. 

Thibault Alix - Lead Android Developer at Fullscreen Inc. Thibault has been developing Android applications for the last 5 years and has worked in the health/fitness and media industries. 

• Message from our Sponsor

Masashi Katsumata (Google Maps API GDE) 

Social Rewards,inc. runs a project called "SelfieW.me".  We have been developing a photo booth which is able to take photos with movie characters using a large Android touch screen.  We will briefly explain our goals and some interesting technical points.

Due to speaker availability, this meetup will not be co-located in NoHo.

events.description:
Come join GDG Los Angeles for our final meetup of 2015.  We'll start the evening with a behind-the-scenes look at our recent DevFest event, including a deep-dive into the Polymer template used to power our DevFest site and how we host it for free using GitHub pages.  We'll close with our year-end prize raffle.  All past attendees are already entered, but you increase your odds of winning by attending this meetup, so we hope to see you there!

Pre-register for faster entrance at: https://generalassemb.ly/education/gdg-los-angeles-end-of-year-meetup/los-angeles/19492

events.description:
We're kicking off this year's Android Study Jam session with a livestream from Google and Udacity.  Anyone can join and watch at:

https://plus.google.com/u/0/events/c91ccjj6745t0r4e4sh9ki3sqd0

If you're interested in learning how to start programming in Android, then Android Study Jam is for you.

GDG LA will be hosting a series of meetups in which we learn together.  This was a huge success last year and we're excited to do it again this year.  Stay tuned for the date of our first in person Study Jam.

events.name: Women TechMakers LA Conference 2016
events.description:
March is International Women's month and SMC, and GDG LA are hosting a Women Techmakers conferences as part of a global series of events to encourage, discuss and promote women in the technology sector. The first Google Women Techmakers Conference in Southern California will be hosted at Santa Monica College's Bundy campus on Saturday March 26 from 9am-2pm. 

The day consists of a panel discussion, break out group discussions, flash mentoring as well as a Google Cardboard programming and Android programming sessions after lunch. Please bring your laptop!

Panelists include: Eleanor Basilio, Cross Mission System Group Supervisor at Caltech-Jet Propulsion Laboratory; Kyle Dorman, Software Engineer and Development Manager and Intern Manager at SpaceX; Narda Fargotstein, Technical Project Manager at Universal Music Group; Megan Huang, Principal Engineer at Gas Technology Institute; and Jennifer Terrill, CIO at iPayment.

Registration is required at http://www.eventbrite.com/e/women-techmakers-los-angeles-2016-tickets-21605468538

events.name: GDG LA - GCP Next Condensed
events.description:
Please pre-register for our event at:

https://gdglosangelesmeetup.splashthat.com/

Come join GDG LA as we experience the Google Cloud Platform Next event in a condensed format. For those of you who can't make the two day event in San Francisco, we'll bring the best to you! During our event you can work as a team through codelabs, watch videos of the keynote and sessions, socialize and eat!

events.name: April Android Meetup
events.description:
This is the first in a series of new meetups focusing exclusively on Android. Each meetup will include a talk on an aspect of Android development, time to socialize with food and drink, time to look at member apps, and a prize giveaway.

Presentations

Unit Testing and Android by Bret Erickson (Android Engineer at Victorious)

An overview of several frameworks, Mockito, PowerMock, and Robolectric that will help you write the unit tests you need for your Android App.

Creating Mockups for Android by Alvin Fong (Android Engineer at Victorious)

Given that most designers come from an iOS background, how do we speak their language? I will be talking about how to work with designers to create flexible layouts for Android.

events.name: May Android Meetup
events.description:
Come join us for an exciting Android meetup in which we review some of the newest topics presented at Google I/O.

As always, Food and drink will be served and prizes will be given away.

If you are interested in giving a lightning talk on some android functionality that you are familiar with please contact [masked].

Pitches of apps and solicitations of any kind are only permitted by paid sponsors and longtime members and must be approved in advance.

Talks

• Google IO Recap by Edward Foux

• Model View Presenter Pattern by Pratyush Kshirsagar

events.name: June Android Meetup
events.description:
Come join GDG Los Angeles for our June Android Meetup.

Once again we'll be meeting at Victorious's offices in Santa Monica.  Parking is available in the Santa Monica City Lots on 2nd street.  You can also take the new Metro Expo line.

This month we'll be learning more about Firebase. Member lightning talks are welcome as long as you let me know in advance. 

Presenters

The Building of Android App from the Ground Up - Reid Isaki

Listen to professional software developer and longtime GDG Member, Reid Isaki as he walks you through how he built a proof-of-concept new photo Android app.

Android Data Binding - build apps faster by Pratyush Kshirsagar (Android Developer at Victorious)

We will discuss about most widely used binding library called Butter Knife and also the pre package data binding available in Android.  How do they help reduce boiler plate code and minimize developer time.  Go through code to actually use them and finally what care should be taken to select one over the other.

events.name: Learn about AMP - Accelerated Mobile Pages
events.description:
Come join GDG Los Angeles as we gratefully welcome Malte Ubl to speak to us about AMP, Accelerated Mobile Pages.

Malte Ubl is a software engineer at Google and a tech lead of the AMP Project. He spent many years of building JavaScript infrastructure for Google and is a curator at JSConf EU, the labour-of-love conference for the JS community in Europe.

events.name: July Android Meetup
events.description:
Aaron He - Memory Leak

Come listen to professional software engineer and past speaker Aaron He as he talks about Memory Leak.

Andy Lawton - MVP+

MVP+ Building upon the MVP foundation we will discuss using the Target pattern, Dependency Injection and View Models to provide a robust and testable foundation for your apps.

events.description: Come join us for a special talk by past speaker Mark Scheel who is coming all the way from Denver to meet with us.  Mark will be giving us an exclusive presentation on Alternate Reality Games with an in-depth look at the Firebass contest launched by Google at their I/0 2016 event earlier this year.

events.name: GDG/LA DevFest 2016
events.description:
Tickets can be bought at: https://devfestla16.eventbrite.com/

More info is available at: https://devfest.gdgla.org

Google Developer Group Los Angeles is proud to announce the second annual GDG DevFest which is the biggest Google related event in Southern California! The event will take place on the 4th of September in Los Angeles.

What to expect In 2015 the conference was visited by 130+ attendees and 30 speakers from all over the world and this year -expanded speakers’ geography from companies like Google, Docker etc. and more 

Google Developer Experts

Rockstar Speaks Include:

Jean-Baptiste Queru, Chet Haase, Romain Guy, Mano Marks, Wesley Chun, Bill Patzert(JPL), Jason Mayes, and more!

Every year more than 80% of our participants are experienced developers, so DFLA will keep technical hardcore without any marketing nonsense.3 parallel tracks dedicated to Android, Web & Cloud technologies.Expanded workshop area where participants will have an opportunity to get some new practical skills from the best developers in Google-related technologies.

So hurry and buy your ticket to get a huge inspiration to create your cool projects after these days in the company of coders, hackers, geeks and just experts of our industry.

Festival organizers

Google Developer Group Los Angeles (GDG Los Angeles) in conjunction with the Google development groups from all over the world. GDGs aim to share experiences and gain new knowledge. Each group - is open to all community of developers that create exciting projects and share their experience with passion about Google technologies.

By the way, it’s pleasure to announce that call for papers is opened! Apply and share with us your knowledge and experience.

events.name: Android @ Tinder
events.description:
Come join GDG LA at Tinder's offices.  We'll hear from Tinder engineers on some of the ways they're using Android to power their popular app.  We'll also get a recap of this year's I/O and all the new goodies introduced by Google.

Space is limited and all attendees will receive a gift, so please RSVP so that we have an accurate headcount.

Drinks/Food

Aaron He - Highlights from Google I/O

Andy Lawton - Deadshot - Tinder will be open sourcing a project that manages the relationship between a View and a Presenter using annotations, while greatly reducing boilerplate and eliminating Context leaking and redundant null checks.  This is a special beta launch that is not yet available to the public!

Kaushik Saurabh - Recycler view layout manager in depth

Mingling / Drinks / Pizza / Shwag and more

events.name: Step 1: Build your own tools. Step 3: take over world
events.description:
Kristan Ucello(a.k.a. Krispy) joins us to talk about doing a project with Firebase and Realm.

Title: "Step One: Build your own tools. Step Three: take over world"

Location: Big Lebowski Conference Room 


Schedule:

Checkin 6:30 to 7

Talk from 7-7:45

Closing questions/thank-yous

Food and networking until 9


Description:
When I arrived at Credit Karma I needed to find and connect with people from different teams across multiple projects and verticals.
The problem was that there was no good way to accomplish this except by talking to as many people at the company as possible to find out about the different roles and groups working on things. I decided I needed a way to search for people in order to speed up my workflow.
This resulted in the design and implementation of a pet project called Aura. This presentation is about the process of creating Aura and how it gathered a cult following of support at Credit Karma. I will be covering the problem space, the technology and the methods of winning mind share that led to the execution of the project. This includes React, Electron, Firebase and a host of other libraries and services that allowed Aura to be built over some weekends without the need of a server.


DIRECTIONS & PARKING INFORMATION:

Public transportation, ridesharing, carpooling, biking, and walking are encouraged. Google will have a visitor parking lot with valet parking, located at 320 Hampton Drive, Venice CA 90291 (Hampton is the block behind Main Street). 
The parking and pedestrian entrances are on Hampton Drive between Sunset Avenue and Rose Avenue. Parking is on the East side of the street. Guests should pull up to the gate and the valet team situated inside of the gate will direct the guest where to park. Please note, you will be required to leave your keys with the valet team. The valet team will direct you to the Big Lebowski reception room to formally check-in. The pedestrian entrance is on the West side of Hampton Drive, near the corner of Sunset Avenue. 

#android #java #javascript #SQLite #JSON #API

events.name: Machine Learning and Tensor Flow with Josh Gordon of Google
events.description:
https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/N_Nk4NMg4L3_1o8bj1eZR53rigiJXXkt34APyPBqb_gU3WmpCCyG5ArT69qkC80wNtuSHyUImM6R5fVpm_jWjSORekbJJkA=s688

Data Science has saved the day and will host what will be one of our hottest meetups of the year.  Josh Gordon (of YouTube fame) leads Machine Learning advocacy at Google.  If you like his videos, you'll love him in person.  Join us as we learn about Machine Learning, Tensor Flow, and the future of computing.  Bring you laptop to try things out yourself.  Save time and install Tensor Flow 1.3 and Jupyter ahead of time.  Flux Capacity not required.

https://www.tensorflow.org/install/

http://jupyter.org/install.html

Pizza and drinks will be served and prizes will be raffled away at the end.  All are welcome!  No fee required.

Parking & Other Info:

• Enter from Hannum Ave into the parking structure for the[masked] buildings. 
• Once you park, exit the parking structure on P4.
• Head across the courtyard veering slightly to the right and you will see the 200 building. Take the elevator to the second floor. If you find the 300 or 100 buildings you are in the wrong place. 
• Parking is free in the lot, after 6:30 PM the gates are open and people are free to leave.

events.name: DevFest Los Angeles 2017
events.description:
Google Developer Group Los Angeles (GDGLA) is proud to announce the third annual DevFest Los Angeles taking place November 4th in Downtown Los Angeles.

DevFest LA 2017 will bring experts from around the country who specialize in the latest Google technologies including Android, Firebase, Google Cloud Platform, Google Assistant, Flutter, machine learning, and more.

As an attendee you can listen to talks, work on codelabs, participate in a hackathon and more.

Tickets are being sold at https://devfestla2017.eventbrite.com/ 

Event details are at https://devfest2017.gdgla.org

events.name: Let’s live code in Flutter
events.description:
• What we'll do
Let’s live code a Flutter app from start to finish We’ll look at designing a UI using hot-reload, pulling in data over a network and even accessing some native code for those tricky platform-specific APIs. Let’s see how far we can get building an app in half an hour!

About Emily Fortuna:
Emily is a Senior Software Engineer on the Dart team. When not hacking on compilers and evangelizing the awesomeness of Flutter, she can be found working on improving fairness in Machine Learning or acting on the stage and screen. She is an avid member of the nerdy joke appreciation society.

About Matt Sullivan:
Matt leads developer relations for Flutter from Google’s Mountain View campus. He recently joined the Flutter team, having spent three years working on Android and Wear. He’s a bit of a language geek, and is thoroughly enjoying adding Dart to the portfolio of languages to write cool things in. When he’s not hacking on Flutter, you’ll probably find him in the gym wearing far too many fitness sensors.

• What to bring
Bring your laptop, appetite, and luck for winning raffles!

• Important to know
We'll have food, drinks and prizes to give away!
Parking is not available at Google, so we encourage carpooling, ride sharing, public transit, etc.
events.how_to_find_us: There's a door on the corner of Sunset Ave and Hampton Dr

events.name: I/O Extended Recap
events.description:
Come learn about some of the announcements made at I/O 2018. Get help completing codelabs. Eat some food and win some prizes.

Topics Include:
Android
Firebase
Flutter
Crostini

Prizes Include:
Daydream viewer, Google Home Mini, Google Play Credit

events.name: Android, Kotlin, Food and Prizes
events.description:
Come join us as we visit Hush's new offices in downtown LA's world famous OUE US Bank Tower. We'll be learning about Android, Kotlin and gRPC, and more.

Talks:
- Bret Erickson: Simplifying Android with Kotlin Extensions
- Will King: Intro to gRPC & Protocol Buffers
- Bret Erickson: Simple Animations with ConstraintLayout

Speakers:
Bret Erickson - Senior Android Developer @ Hush, Inc.
Bret has years of experience building Android apps for several tech startups with a passion for software craftsmanship."

Will King - CTO @ Hush, Inc.
Will loves using modern technology to build better software.

Food, Drink and Prizes will be served!

Getting Here:
- There are several parking garages (including inside the bank tower itself). Cheapest evening rates appear to be ~$8 at the 524 South Flower Street garage which is a block from the building.

- Once inside the Bank Tower you will need to check in at the front desk with a valid ID. All RSVPs will have their name added to the guest list in advance. If you wish to bring a +1, please direct message Bret Erickson so they are also included on the guest list.

- Hush's office space is located on floor 57, you'll be directed to an elevator to the 54th floor, which you'll then use to take a second elevator to the 57th floor.

events.name: Flutter Study Jam
events.description:
Flutter is Google’s mobile app SDK for crafting high-quality native interfaces on iOS and Android in record time. Flutter works with existing code, is used by developers and organizations around the world, and is free and open source.

Want to get started on building Flutter apps?

Join us for our Flutter Study Jam! Together we'll work through Flutter Udacity Course prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Flutter and build a Flutter app while learning the fundamentals..

Bring a laptop! The course will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, the laptop should have Flutter installed on it prior to starting the study jam to save time. Windows/Linux/Mac would all be fine.
Check out : https://flutter.io/get-started/install/

Agenda:
5:00pm: Flutter Udacity Course Introduction
6:10pm: Udacity Course Lesson 1
6:30pm: Break
7:00pm: Udacity Course Lesson 1 continue
8:00pm: Event ends

This is not a traditional type of meetup for GDGLA, it is more of a working session, so you will need to bring your own laptop. We'll supply wifi, power and light refreshments, as well as assistance in getting through the course.

events.name: Flutter Study Jam Part 2 (Hangout and Live)
events.description:
This is the second in a series of Flutter Study Jam sessions.
You can join via hangouts at: https://meet.google.com/ddg-isuk-pqq

This is open to everyone even those who didn't attend our first study jam session. In this session we will work on Lesson 2 of the Flutter Udacity course.

events.name: Flutter Study Jam Part 3 (Hangout and Live)
events.description:
This is the third in a series of Flutter Study Jam sessions.
You can join via hangouts at: https://meet.google.com/ddg-isuk-pqq

This is open to everyone even those who didn't attend our first or second study jam session. In this session we will work on Lesson 2 of the Flutter Udacity course.

Food, Drink and Prizes will be served!

Getting Here:
- There are several parking garages (including inside the bank tower itself). Cheapest evening rates appear to be ~$8 at the 524 South Flower Street garage which is a block from the building.

- Once inside the Bank Tower you will need to check in at the front desk with a valid ID. All RSVPs will have their name added to the guest list in advance. If you wish to bring a +1, please direct message Bret Erickson so they are also included on the guest list.

events.name: Migrate, Modernize & Scale Your Infrastructure
events.description:
This is a “Coffee & Cloud” @ Google Venice Meet-up for Regional Business & IT Leaders sponsored by Dito.

Join us for an interactive discussion on:
- Discover the tools that can assist in quantifying the costs associated with modernizing your infrastructure, along with the tangible steps to migrating key workloads
- Improve DevOps productivity and ability to innovate with serverless computing
-Quick wins and turnkey APIs to tame & train your data for new insights
-Solve the cloud security, scalability and cost challenges in one platform
-Understand the value-add services and programs available exclusively through full-stack Premier Partners, like Dito

Registration is required due to security, so please register at:
https://www.ditoweb.com/lp/event-google-cloud-platform-los-angeles-nov-01/

events.name: Polymer, web components, & why you should care!
events.description:
Come join us at TechHire LA to learn about Polymer.

About TechHire LA:
In 2016, the White House awarded Youth Policy Institute $4 million to expand tech access to the diverse communities of Los Angeles. Through an innovative job training program, TechHire prepares individuals for high-demand careers in technology requiring no degree.

Since then, we've connected employers to job seekers who possess the skills and the drive to succeed in the industry. We specialize in bridging candidates who've taken unconventional paths to acquiring the requisite skills to reputable employers filling the digital divide in Los Angeles.

Talk:
Polymer, web components, & why you should care - Christopher Schmitz
Despite being introduced over 3 years ago by Google, including native support by all major browsers of the underlying standard (web components), Polymer doesn't have the same buzz behind it as some other web technologies...yet. This session will cover the basics of Polymer and web components in general and why they're important to pay attention to, even if you aren't a web developer. With the backing of Google, and use by major companies like Coca-Cola, McDonald's, Comcast, and of course Google in large scale projects, it's a safe bet Polymer's only just getting started.

Chrome Dev Tools for Beginners - Anna Veretennikova
Chrome DevTools are a developer’s best friend. You may get by without them, but having these instruments in your toolbox will boost your performance and will make your life easier overall. Starting from measuring those pixels and identifying colors to debugging specific javascript frameworks. This will not be a deep dive into each of them, but rather an overview that will enable you to explore further on your own.

Speaker:
Christopher Schmitz - Senior Android Developer @ Disney
Chris has been a mobile developer for over a decade, leading Android development on apps reaching millions of users at companies like CitySearch, Break.com, and Disney, including the new Play Disney Parks app. He's also leading the development of a Polymer based open source project, the Collaboration Tree (cTree.org).

Anna Veretennikova - Fullstack JavaScript Developer with experience in Node.js, Angularjs, React + Redux.

Food, Drink and Prizes will be served!

Getting Here:
- There is rooftop parking on Beverly, right past the office.

events.name: DevFest 2018 Los Angeles
events.description:
DevFest 2018 Los Angeles is the largest annual gathering for the Los Angeles developer community using and developing with Google technology and developer tools. It’s a 100% community organized conference with industry experts presenting on multiple topics.

This is a paid event with ticket sales being handled by Eventbrite at:
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/devfest-los-angeles-tickets-48637325550

More information about the event is available at:
https://devfest.gdgla.org

events.name: Cloud Study Jam: IoT in the Google Cloud
events.description:
Want to get started on the Google Cloud, but don't know where to begin? Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!
Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with the Cloud Console & IoT on Cloud.
Then after our live session, you will have free access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted badge for your online profile, and additional 30 days access to the training platform to compete any labs you want.

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don’t forget your charger.

events.name: IWD: International Women's Day Event
events.description:
Come celebrate International Women's Day with Women TechMakers. There will be speed networking, a photo booth and a panel of women in tech speakers from all over LA. And of course swag and prizes.

=======================
Networking:
Prepare an elevator pitch for networking. You will only have a few minutes with each person, so make them count!

Don't forget business cards!
========================
Security:

Please have everyone register with their first and last name so that they can be on the list for security. If you are bringing a guest then message me with their name please.

There is a security guard posted at the Hampton Dr gate from 5:30-7pm to grant you access into the event space. When guests arrive at BIN5 reception (320 Hampton Dr) there will be signage to direct down the block to the gate where security guard will be posted.
=======================

Parking:
Parking at LAX is very impacted and we're unable to accommodate for external guests during business hours. Fortunately, there are various off-site parking options for external guests that are all within 6 minutes walking distance of the office. I've provided a link below that will give more details on the options. I would also suggest using a ride share services like Uber and Lyft. The address to arrive to is 320 Hampton Dr. Venice, Ca 90291
http://bit.ly/googleLAeventparking

=======================

Thank you and I'm so excited for this event!

events.name: Focus on your code, not infrastructure with Google Cloud...
events.description:
Title:Focus on your code, not infrastructure, with Google Cloud Functions

Description: In this talk, we will follow the story of the fictional startup "In Jest", publishers of an app that tells jokes. At first, the developers at "In Jest" need to get a minimum viable product up and running in an hour. As their business grows they will have to integrate with Google Sheets, databases, analytics systems, marketing systems and so on. We will see the 100 lines of code needed to make this happen, without having to worry the team about servers and data centers.

Martin Omander bio: Martin Omander works for Google in Mountain View, California. His job in the Developer Relations team is to help developers build better software, and improve Google's Cloud Platform to make it even better for that purpose. In his spare time he manages to sneak in some game programming. Before Google, Martin worked at string of startups in Silicon Valley as a software engineer.

Zoe Omander: Zoe is 13 years old, an online student, guitar player and YouTuber. She is also Martin's daughter and will present together with him.

events.name: Android Event @ PickTrace
events.description:
We’re so excited to host our next Meetup at PickTrace! Like always, refreshments will be served and we’ll have a raffle at the end. ✨

The event is planned in 4 sections:
- arrivals/meet and greet
- brief intro to PickTrace
- James Henderson will be presenting on Kotlin Coroutines
- informal networking / hangout time

PickTrace is generously providing pizza 🍕 and beer 🍺 so don’t worry about missing dinner. There’s also a ping pong table for anyone interested in a bit of friendly competition!

Find us at 211 N. Brand Blvd, Glendale, CA 91203.

If you enter through the main doors on Brand, please walk up the stairs to the 2nd floor. (The bottom vacant floor used to be a Museum of Selfies pop up).

Convenient parking is located at 222 N. Orange Street, Glendale, CA 91203. We think it’s 90 minutes free, check signage to confirm.
